188 TRANSLA TJONS.

The shepherds on the lawn, Or e'er the point of dawn, Sat simply chatting in a rustic row; Full little thought they then, That the mighty Pan Was kindly come to live with thern below; Perhaps their loves, or else their sheep,

Was all that did their silly thoughts so busy keep.

When such music sweet Their hearts and ears did greet,

As never was by mortal finger strook‚ Divinely-warbled voice Answering the stringed noise,

As all their souls in blissful rapture took: The air, such pleasure loth to lose,

With thousand echoes still prolongs each heavenly close.
